name: diplomatist
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an official whose job is to represent one country in another, and who usually works in an embassy: He held an interview with a prominent former U.S. diplomatist. He dismissed the conference as just another gathering of national diplomatists.
approving a person who is skilled at dealing with difficult situations in a way that does not offend people: He's both a fine judge of a player and a skilled diplomatist. She was a naturally gifted diplomatist.
More examplesFewer examplesHe is the first European diplomatist to seek broader support from the public as a whole.This could have been avoided by a greater degree of honesty and skill on the diplomatists’ part.
